page.title: 06FLORA AND FAUNA
page.content: On a walk near our school we were able to identify many different species of animals, plants and trees.We have listed the ones we saw. {Hedgehogs} are small creatures about 17cm long and covered in spines.They eat mainly insects and slugs and worms and live in grassy nests. {Moles}are also insectivores living under ground almost any where in open land and woods.They are very good diggers! {Rabbits}also live under ground but they eat plant matter.They are small furry creatures of a greyish_brown colour. {Common Shrews}are insctivores.They are very small creatures only about 6cm long and they look like small moles . {The squirrels}in the woods are {Red {sqirrels}obviously red in colour with large bushy tails which go almost
